name: Appointments, Promotions & Transfers
description: Appointment procedures, promotion, transfer, probation and related rules from PSR 2021 Chapter 2.

questions.question: Who has primary authority to make appointments to posts graded GL.07 to GL.17 in the Federal Civil Service?
questions.explanation: PSR 020102 specifies that the Federal Civil Service Commission makes appointments to posts graded GL.07–GL.17 (advertised/competitive).

questions.question: According to PSR 020101, appointments to offices in the Federal Civil Service are made on the authority of:
options: The Head of the Civil Service
questions.explanation: PSR 020101 states appointments are made on the authority of the Federal Civil Service Commission (FCSC), by letter or formal agreement.

questions.question: PSR 020102 requires that competitive advertisements for GL.07–GL.10 posts be placed in:
options: Three national newspapers and the Commission’s website
questions.explanation: PSR 020102 provides that advertisements for such posts must appear in three national newspapers and on the Commission’s website.

questions.question: Under PSR 020201, a person appointed on probation must normally serve a probation period of:
options: 1 year (or as specified in the appointment letter)
questions.explanation: PSR 020201 (Rules on Probation) indicates probationary periods are normally one year or as specified in the letter of appointment.

questions.question: If an officer fails to pass a compulsory confirmation examination after three consecutive attempts, PSR 030104 provides that the officer shall:
options: Be required to resign or withdraw from service
Be reclassified to a different cadre
questions.explanation: PSR 030104 (Compulsory Confirmation Exams) states failure after three attempts may result in resignation or withdrawal from service.

questions.question: Which rule requires that acting appointments be recommended on Form Gen. 66 and be gazetted, and that acting appointment periods should normally not exceed one year?
questions.explanation: PSR 020704 sets out the procedure and limits for acting appointments, including Form Gen. 66 and gazettement; ordinarily not exceeding one year.

questions.question: PSR 020705 describes the date of commencement and cessation for acting appointments. The gazetted date of commencement should normally be:
options: The date the acting officer takes over duties
The last working day of the substantive holder
The date of Permanent Secretary’s approval
questions.explanation: PSR 020705 explains the gazetted commencement date is normally the date the acting officer assumes duties (with related conditions).

questions.question: According to PSR 020801, what is a primary eligibility condition for promotion in the Federal Civil Service?
options: Meeting eligibility criteria and selection process including merit
questions.explanation: PSR 020801–020804 set out promotion eligibility based on merit, criteria for the post, and selection process — not political endorsement.

questions.question: Under PSR 020803, an officer on leave or secondment may still:
options: Be allowed to sit promotion/confirmation examinations if authorized
questions.explanation: PSR 020803 indicates officers on leave or secondment may be permitted to sit promotion exams where prescribed procedures are followed.

questions.question: PSR 020701 states acting appointments are not to be used as:
options: A means of rewarding exemplary performance
A method to fill temporarily vacant posts
A form of trial for promotion
questions.explanation: PSR 020701 clarifies acting appointments are not intended as a form of trial for promotion; they are to fill temporary vacancies.

questions.question: Which PSR rule requires the appointment process for GL.07–GL.10 to include a Public/Civil Service Entry Examination?
questions.explanation: PSR 020102 prescribes an annual competitive Public/Civil Service Entry Examination for new entrants to GL.07–GL.10 posts.

questions.question: PSR 020206 indicates that certain appointments require prior approval. Which is a typical case requiring prior approval?
options: Appointment into senior posts where power remains with the Commission
questions.explanation: PSR 020206 and related rules indicate appointment to senior posts often require prior FCSC approval and adherence to delegated powers.

questions.question: According to PSR 020301–020305, the period of probation ends with:
options: Automatic permanent appointment regardless of performance
Confirmation if performance is satisfactory or termination if unsatisfactory
questions.explanation: PSR Section on probation (020301–020305) requires confirmation on satisfactory completion or termination otherwise.

questions.question: PSR 020401–020410 covers posting and redeployment. Which statement aligns with PSR guidance on posting?
options: Posting decisions are entirely at the officer's discretion
Posting follows prescribed procedures and may include spouse location provisions
Posting is a substitute for promotion
questions.explanation: PSR rules on posting (020401 et seq.) require established procedures and include special considerations such as spouse posting provisions.

questions.question: What does PSR 020601–020608 say about the effective date of promotion?
options: Promotions take effect on the date of the next fiscal year only
Effective date is usually specified and related to gazette/reporting; it governs salary and seniority
Promotion dates are decided by unions
questions.explanation: PSR promotion provisions specify effective dates which determine salary, seniority and increments, usually documented in promotion notices.

questions.question: PSR 020704(b) indicates the acting appointment may be extended beyond one year only in:
options: Any circumstance the Permanent Secretary prefers
Situations of staff shortage without approval
questions.explanation: PSR 020704(b) allows extension of acting appointment for another year only in exceptional circumstances as prescribed by the Commission.

questions.question: Which PSR rule requires notification to the FCSC when an officer reverts from acting appointment?
questions.explanation: PSR 020707 requires Ministries to notify the Federal Civil Service Commission (via Form Gen. 15A) when acting appointment ceases and the officer reverts.

questions.question: PSR 020808 addresses promotion of contract officers. Which is true?
options: Contract officers are automatically promoted after 2 years
Promotion of contract officers depends on terms of contract and eligibility
Contract officers are ineligible for any promotion
Promotions for contract staff are dictated by unions
questions.explanation: PSR provisions on contract appointments indicate promotion for contract officers depends on contract terms and eligibility conditions set out in the Rules.

questions.question: PSR guidance on transfers and secondments (020501–020512) states salary while on secondment should be:
options: Stopped and paid by receiving agency
Paid in accordance with specific transfer/secondment arrangement to ensure continuity
questions.explanation: PSR transfer/secondment rules require clear arrangements on salary payment for continuity when officers are seconded or transferred.

questions.question: According to PSR 020305, confirmation of officers holding senior posts depends on:
options: Completion of a new appointment letter only
Satisfactory performance and the prescribed confirmation procedures
questions.explanation: PSR rules on confirmation require satisfactory performance and adherence to the confirmation process, especially for senior posts.

questions.question: PSR 020110/020111 (Certificate of Service) indicates that upon leaving, officers may request a Certificate of Service. Who authorizes it?
options: Appropriate authority such as Permanent Secretary or appointing authority
questions.explanation: PSR provision on Certificate of Service specifies that the appropriate appointing authority (e.g., Permanent Secretary) issues such certificates on request.

questions.question: PSR 020901 et seq. states leaving the service due to abolition of office should trigger:
options: Compensation or gratuity as determined by Government
questions.explanation: PSR rules provide for compensation or gratuity for officers leaving service as a result of abolition or reorganization of offices.

questions.question: What does PSR 020612 imply about incremental dates when promotions occur?
options: Incremental dates are irrelevant after promotion
Incremental dates may be adjusted in accordance with promotion effective dates
Incremental dates change automatically to 1 January
Incremental dates are solely at supervisor discretion
questions.explanation: PSR on increments and promotion indicates incremental dates are considered when promotions take effect and may be adjusted accordingly.

questions.question: PSR 020605 describes eligibility for promotion to Permanent Secretary level; which factor is core?
options: Fulfilling eligibility criteria, experience, and selection process
questions.explanation: Promotion to top posts follows strict eligibility, experience and selection criteria as set out by PSR and FCSC guidelines.

questions.question: Under PSR posting and redeployment rules, an aggrieved officer with posting complaints should:
options: Follow the prescribed complaints procedure and route through HR or relevant committee
questions.explanation: PSR posting rules provide a formal complaints/appeal procedure for posting grievances to be addressed by appropriate authorities.

questions.question: According to PSR 020208, what are the main types of appointment recognized in the Public Service?
options: Permanent, temporary, contract and acting appointments
questions.explanation: PSR 020208 identifies permanent, temporary, contract, and acting as the recognized types of appointment within the Public Service.

questions.question: Under PSR 020209, which category of persons are considered ineligible for appointment without prior approval of the Federal Civil Service Commission?
options: Retired officers previously dismissed or retired compulsorily
questions.explanation: PSR 020209 prohibits reappointment of officers previously dismissed or retired compulsorily unless with prior FCSC approval.

questions.question: PSR 020210 provides that every officer on appointment must complete which form?
questions.explanation: PSR 020210 mandates newly appointed officers to complete Form Gen. 62 capturing personal particulars and service records.

name: Discipline & Misconduct
description: Misconduct, disciplinary procedures, sanctions, interdiction, suspension and related rules from PSR 2021 Chapter 10.
